title: Sleep Disorder Screening
name: Epworth Sleepiness Scale
description: The Epworth Sleepiness Scale (ESS) is a 7-item questionnaire that measures the tendency to fall asleep during the day. The ESS is a validated and reliable instrument that has been used in a variety of clinical and research settings. The ESS is a self-report questionnaire that takes approximately 1 minute to complete. The ESS is scored by summing the responses to the 7 items. The ESS has been shown to be a valid and reliable measure of daytime sleepiness.
instructions: Please answer the following questions by selecting the appropriate response.

questions.text: Sitting inactive in a public place (e.g. a theater or a meeting)
As a passenger in a car for an hour without a break
Lying down to rest in the afternoon when circumstances permit
Sitting quietly after a lunch without alcohol
In a car, while stopped for a few minutes in traffic
